task.title: Record the M800 Setup
task.shortdesc: This entry describes how to record the customer’s M800 meter setup.

context.p: Record the customer’s setup so that it can be restored after the transmitter recalibration and the customer can place the M800 back into service quickly.

steps.stepsection: To record the setup of an M800 meter:

step.cmd: Use the USB cable to connect the M800 to the computer.
Open the M800 Transmitter Calibration Tool (TCT) program.
step.info: If the M800 software is older than 1.3.00, the TCT will not work. In that case, the configuration must be checked manually and settings written on the customer’s paperwork.

step.cmd: Click Get All Transmitter Setup Files.
Once the files transfer successfully, the program will give the message “Get all transmitter setup files successfully!” Press OK.
Store the setup files in the network.

substep.cmd: Click Save All Transmitter Setup Files
In the dialog box, rename the folder with the RMA number, then click OK.

step.cmd: When done, press EXIT then OK to close the program.
